meanings.definition: A feeling that something bad will happen; a premonition.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't shake off the forebodings of impending doom.
meanings.sent2: His forebodings about the test turned out to be true.
meanings.sent3: Despite her forebodings, the surprise party was a success.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds gathered, casting forebodings over the peaceful town.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence in the forest filled him with forebodings.

meanings.definition: An omen or sign of future misfortune.
meanings.sent1: The black cat crossing their path was seen as a foreboding of bad luck.
meanings.sent2: The sudden drop in temperature was a foreboding of the coming storm.
meanings.sent3: Finding a broken mirror is considered a foreboding in some cultures.
meanings.sent4: The howling of the wolves was a foreboding of danger in the night.
meanings.sent5: The old house had an air of foreboding that sent shivers down her spine.
